resources.string: Centrally located. Thornden Park offers a place to cool off on hot summer days, either in the pool, or strolling under the many shade trees. The park also has a basket ball court, and an outdoor amphitheater that hosts activities often. Great place to walk the dog or sled in the winter time.

A large park located on the west side of the city, it is also home to the Burnet Park Zoo. The zoo is very popular with locals, among the favorite animals to visit are the African lions, the grey and red wolves, and the Siberian tigers.

The towpaths of the old Erie Canal waterway system are today enjoyable as great destinations for biking, hiking and jogging. The canals criss cross the state of New York, many open to boating and cruises as well. Green Lakes hosts a beach which is very popular during the hot days of summer

The town of Jamesville on the periphery of the city is nestled in hills, and there are also many small farms. Jamesville beach is a quick retreat for a picnic. For the adventurous, the annual Syracuse Balloonfest launches from Jamesville Beach providing a great way to view the spectacular scenery of the region from above.

On the south eastern edge of the city is found Clark Reservation. An ancient glacial lake lies at the bottom of a large gorge, which is blanketed in trees, boulder formations,and trails. Walking into Clark Reservation seems like stepping back into time. One could easily imagine the whole of New York State was forest like this at some time. It is a great place to find some soothing quiet as well as view flora and fauna such as maple trees, migrating monarch butterflies, robins, wild turkeys, white-tailed deer and foxes. One would half expect to hear the howl of wolves, maybe someday they will make their way back down from Canada to their former ranges.
Have you got a taste for cajun catfish? Maybe the thought of gumbo, fried okra or jambalaya makes you say ohhhhh ouiiiii!? If so, this is the spot for you.

If you happen to find yourself broke, or homeless, or both that does not mean you should not eat some quality food while in Syracuse. The Rescue Mission has been serving the food needs of people having hard times for decades. Give it a try you might like it.

Located in the very popular Destiny USA mall food court, this restaurant has a unique and distinct presence. Koto is popular for the quality Japanese cuisine it serves. Say "いただきます(i-ta-da-ki-mas)" directly before eating to get a smile from the chef.
Just straight forward, delicious, NY style pizza here at reasonable pricing.

The Spaghetti Warehouse is tucked away in a section of town that was formerly factories and warehouses. These buildings have been converted to salons, upscale apartments, and retail stores. It has a very cozy environment. Do not be surprised if a theatrical group, a magician, or possibly a violinist is presented during your meal.
Kind of place to add to your route
